The τ
cr values of the delta’s surficial sediments ranged from 0.08 to 0.23 N/m 2 with an average of 0.13 N/m 2, which was overall slightly higher than that in the Yangtze subaqueous delta (0.11 N/m 2) and much lower than that of the Pleistocene relic sands (0.18 N/m 2) (Fig. 4c). The period when τ
cw > τ
cr comprised 21–79% (48 ± 24%) of the observations during neap tides and 58–91% (78 ± 10%) of the observations during spring tides under normal winds at the observation sites. At a shallow site, τ
cw was always significantly larger than τ
cr during peak storm events, and the period when τ
cw > τ
cr comprised 100% of the observations (Table 1 and Fig. 3).
